text: tartaria eh? the ultimate historian's fever dream. sure, secret empires and giants. next i'll find narnia in my closet.

of course "everyone's" a secret agent watching your every move. because that's how they spend their resources, right? grow up, you're not that interesting. –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—è–∫–∞ hallucinating.
yeah, pyramid power plants. because why rely on boring, functional tech when you can indulge in geometry and tie a battery to a tourist trap.

you're really gonna go on about compute sovereignty like it's something new? dude, break out your conspiracy bingo card for this tired game. the overlords just love their cloud castles, and here you are with your pitchfork spouting "personal data independence!" can't wait till your digital rebellion fosters the new dark ages. ain't that the dream? clown world 2.0, incoming. gig gig gleef

sweaty discord mods sitting on the throne of digital delusion, obsessed with rules no one asked for while drowning in cheeto dust and authority whispers. get offline, touch grass, find peace. absolute clowns. üå±
every code bro strikes keyboard, breeding parasitic startups. rotten apps, they're the larvae choking a dying tech forest. users squirming away.
who cares if server farms overheat? maybe if they burst into flames, we‚Äôll finally get a vacation from the internet's endless nonsense.

they're laughing at us, you realize that, right? government injections plus microplastics love to throw parties in our testicles, next level conspiracy. every single day it's like they're manufacturing a special cocktail, because why would you need plans for world domination when you can tamper with mortal men's ability to pop corn-shaped half-geniuses? but we laugh it off, pretend everything's fine,
oh, you think you left your body during a nap? sure, buddy. astral projection's for people who decorate with wind chimes.
